content:
We are making good progress in the notifications part of the "Follow Topics" feature. -- #25640 , #design > notifications of Followed Topics

The issue to track progress: #25673

In parallel, let's start discussions around the following:

  • Option to automatically follow a topic.

    • A topic should be automatically followed when you send a message to it. Any other case?
    • Where should we put this setting? -- A checkbox in #settings/topics?

  • Ability to follow a topic from the left sidebar three-dot menu.

    • We currently have mute/unmute options (toggle). How are we planning to fit in the "follow" option here?
cc: @Alya Abbott @Abhijeet Bodas Tim Abbott

@Vlad Korobov I think you had a proposal for how to add "follow topic" to the UI in the message header bar and the left sidebar?

If I recall correctly, for the message header bar, Vlad Korobov proposed showing an icon for the current state, and then clicking on it would open a dropdown to select any of the three options (mute, unmute, follow). We would no longer use highlighted/unhighlighted icons to indicate the current state.

I just filed #25914, #25915 and #25917 as proposed solutions for the questions above, plus #25918. These are all linked from #25673.

Normally, I'd start most of these with a conversation here, but since I'm going on leave in a week, it seemed more expedient to get concrete proposals written up. We can definitely modify these based on further discussion.
Not sure if drop-down or a tab bar but conceptually yes: showing the current state and let user pick out of N options

I'm working on #26016 , which makes it possible to follow a topic from the topic three-dot menu in the left sidebar.

We need an icon for the "Follow topic" option. -- Vlad Korobov, can you please help me here?

Question:

As proposed in #25917 , we will have these three options: "Follow topic", "Unmute topic", and "Mute topic".
Topic popover

When a user clicks on one of the options, should we highlight that option and make it non-clickable? (To convey the idea that the topic is now followed/muted/unmuted)

@Vlad Korobov, just to make sure you see this :)
This is being actively worked on in #26016
@Abhijeet Bodas am I correct that following a topic is basically a bigger number of notifications, it is "louder" than a regular topic?
@Prakhar Pratyush
Yes
#25673 has the details.
Hey @Vlad Korobov, It would be really helpful if we could finalize an icon as discussed above. :)

Currently:

  • Open two tabs. In the first one, open /#settings/topics. From the other tab, mute/unmute a topic. This change is not reflected in the settings panel in the other tab.

I have fixed this issue in #26016

Still, I would like to point out the tradeoff we made:

In #25127, we removed this code block.(which resulted in the bug)

The expected behaviour was:

2. Let's not have the topics get resorted when you change the status in this UI, as it makes it harder to
find what you were looking at. The order should just get updated when you navigate away or refresh.

3. When you set a topic to "Default for stream", it should stay in the UI until you refresh or navigate away.
This makes it much easier to review your changes, and undo if needed. It's the same pattern we follow in
the Users panel when an admin deactivates a user, for example.

The tradeoff is:

  • Even if we change the status from the topic popover or message header bar only the status will be updated (It won't get re-sorted by date updated or removed on changing the status to "default for stream").
Thoughts?

Sorry for the delay, I wanted to understand how the whole panel might work. How about having tabs there?
image.png
Vlad Korobov mentioned this topic in #design > UI redesign: recipient bar.

This looks great.

However, the question Prakhar is trying to as is related to just the settings/topics page.
The question being, how do we update that page? Suppose I have the following topics muted currently:
image.png

And then, from another tab, or from my mobile app, I FOLLOW the bulk delete drafts topic. And I'm looking at this settings page right now.
Then, should we completely refresh the list, or only update the value in the "Status" and "Date updated" columns?
Refreshing the entire list might have the effect of disorienting the user, while updating only those two columns (without changing the order of the rows) means the list is not sorted now.
Would be great to know your thoughts on this :)

The other question we have is how to have the UI in the topic popover. Currently the only option we show is to mute the topic:
image.png

We are trying to add the other options (UNMUTE and FOLLOW there as well).

How about having tabs there?

Do you mean that we use tabs inside the topic popover as well?

Do you mean that we use tabs inside the topic popover as well?

Yes, like we are going to do for a theme switch:
image.png
I see! Thanks for clarifying. I think this is a great idea. CC @Prakhar Pratyush

I would love to hear @Tim Abbott feedback.
And should we make this feature before the bar redesign? I guess nothing bad happens if we add 3 little tabs now… we can make them as icons one of which is full opacity now
@Vlad Korobov would also be great to know your thoughts on https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/101-design/topic/Follow.20Topics/near/1598440 :)

Then, should we completely refresh the list, or only update the value in the "Status" and "Date updated" columns?

If you can update the whole list or it is easier we can do it this way for now.

Refreshing the entire list might have the effect of disorienting the user,

Why? Are you changing some order?

while updating only those two columns (without changing the order of the rows) means the list is not sorted now.

I guess the best would be to just update a row representing a topic. But I'm not sure how you can be in both places at the same time and if we have our UI actually reactive. So If you change a setting in another browser tab and this tab sin't updated .... I don't think it is a big deal

Why? Are you changing some order?

Screenshot-from-2023-06-26-18-12-20.png

If we change the status of one of the topics from this panel. Only the status gets updated. If we close the panel or refresh, the panel will be sorted by date updated (latest first)

I think if the whole list is re-rendered according to the last edit it will not be disorienting, because a person comes from a different page back here and the user already did a change, so there is no effect of a sudden change while user is looking on that page

It will be disorienting when we change the status of say 30th row and now suddenly it's on top or gets disappeared (when you select default).
I agree it will not be disorienting when a person comes back from a different page. But it will be when we are just updating the status from the panel. (no extra tabs etc)
Alya Abbott's comment for reference

Vlad Korobov said:

I would love to hear Tim Abbott feedback.
And should we make this feature before the bar redesign? I guess nothing bad happens if we add 3 little tabs now… we can make them as icons one of which is full opacity now

I think tabs like that should work well inside the topic popover, and anywhere else where it feels like we have space. There may be other places, like the "recent conversations" view or recipient bars, where we might want to just display the current state and have the tab-switching UI for it live inside a (potentially small) popover reached from there.
